cyclone.name: ISAIAS
cyclone.current_location: about 55 miles ESE of Cape Canaveral, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: Tracking north, then turning north-northeast parallel to the Georgia coast toward the South Carolina–North Carolina border
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near eastern South Carolina or southern North Carolina (around Myrtle Beach/Surf City)

weather_observation.watch_coast: N/A (port is not in a watch area)
weather_observation.warning_coast: Sebastian Inlet, FL to Ocracoke Inlet, NC (includes entire Georgia coast)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Florida east coast through Georgia and the Carolinas
weather_observation.wind: Brief periods of tropical-storm-force gusts (peak gusts 35–45 mph) possible Monday morning–afternoon
weather_observation.storm_surge: 1–3 ft of surge possible along the Georgia coast, including the Savannah River entrance
weather_observation.rainfall: 1–2 inches of rain with locally higher amounts; minor urban or poor-drainage flooding possible
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous surf and rip currents; isolated tornado risk increases north of the port after passage
